page.title: 11Places of interest in Flint
page.content: The 1610 map by John Speede shows the town of Flint as a rectangular shape surrounded by defence banks called dykes. Today the rectangular street pattern can still be seen in the old part of the town and the street sign saying{Castle Dyke Street.}The town has a great deal of local history. We made a town trail in class showing some of the interesting places to visit. It included the old{Town Hall, built in{1839,}which has a beautiful, old{Council Chamber}containing many historic civic treasures. Next is the site of the{Roman Villa}at Pentre and the{Druid's Stones.}Then{Cornist Park with its hall and golf course, and, in contrast, we have the modern{Leisure {Centre.}Finally, Flint has an{ancient {castle,}built in 1284 by Edward 1, which is well worth a visit.
